ground_truth: The other is half human, half animal. Elijah glances at the business man standing next to him and then back to the sketch. The business man rubs his face and gazes at the sketch. Elijah starts to the back of the store, which is some type of art gallery where all the framed pictures are images and sketches from comic books. Elijah jams his walking stick into the extra thick carpet and stops. He turns and starts back to the businessman, shaking his head strongly. Elijah's eyes pierce through the shaken man as he points at the sketch. Elijah turns and faces the customers for the first time; David Dunne stands with Joseph. Elijah just stands staring for the longest time and then walks closer to them. When Elijah speaks, his voice has a whispery quality to it. David nods while Elijah looks shaken, and Elijah gazes at David, then points at the framed comic sketches. David shakes his head and smiles out of frustration. Elijah watches David walk towards the front door, and through the window, he sees Joseph take David's hand as they cross the street. Elijah gazes out the window in a bit of a daze. David sits up in bed staring at a torn section of newspaper in his hands, while Joseph is asleep horizontally with his legs over David's legs. David slides out from under his son's legs; Joseph stirs but doesn't wake up. David moves to the darkness of the corner of the room, opens a closet door, and a naked hanging bulb goes on as David yanks a chain. David steps inside the narrow closet and closes the door slightly so the light from the bulb doesn't fall on Joseph. There's just enough room to stand and look around as David stretches and feels on the top shelf. His hand comes down with something wrapped in a t-shirt, which he unwraps to reveal a handgun. He stares at it for a beat before wrapping it back up and replacing it to the highest shelf. He stretches even more, reaches farther back, and pulls down a folder jammed with clippings. He opens the folder to reveal a young David in football uniform holding his helmet in the air victoriously. David flips through the top clippings, which are all images and stories of David and football, then turns the pile over to the last clipping. This piece of paper is folded over three times, unlike the others; it's a newspaper headline. David puts the new headline next to the old one, and they look like a set, even the font is similar. David stares at the old headline and stares hard at the photo of the bent and heavily damaged car laying upside down in the middle of the highway.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The alternative is semi-human, semi-creature. Elijah glances at the businessperson standing adjacent to him and then back to the drawing. The businessman rubs his visage and gazes at the sketch. Elijah starts to the back of the shop, which is some kind of art gallery where all the framed illustrations are images and sketches from comic books. Elijah jams his walking cane into the extra dense rug and halts. He turns and starts back to the businessman, shaking his head vigorously. Elijah's eyes pierce through the unsettled man as he points at the sketch. Elijah turns and faces the patrons for the first time; David Dunne stands with Joseph. Elijah just stands staring for the longest duration and then walks closer to them. When Elijah speaks, his voice has a whispery quality to it. David nods while Elijah looks unsettled, and Elijah gazes at David, then points at the framed comic sketches. David shakes his head and smiles out of exasperation. Elijah watches David walk towards the front exit, and through the window, he sees Joseph take David's hand as they traverse the street. Elijah gazes out the window in a bit of a daze. David sits up in bed staring at a torn fragment of newspaper in his hands, while Joseph is asleep horizontally with his legs over David's. David slides out from under his offspring's legs; Joseph stirs but doesn't awaken. David moves to the darkness of the corner of the chamber, opens a closet door, and a bare hanging bulb illuminates as David yanks a chain. David steps inside the narrow closet and closes the door slightly so the light from the bulb doesn't fall on Joseph. There's just enough room to stand and look around as David stretches and feels on the top ledge. His hand comes down with something wrapped in a t-shirt, which he unwraps to reveal a handgun. He stares at it for a beat before wrapping it back up and replacing it to the highest shelf. He stretches even more, reaches farther back, and pulls down a folder jammed with clippings. He opens the folder to reveal a young David in football attire holding his helmet in the air victoriously. David flips through the top clippings, which are all images and stories of David and football, then turns the pile over to the last clipping. This piece of paper is folded over three times, unlike the others; it's a newspaper headline. David puts the new headline next to the old one, and they look like a set, even the font is similar. David stares at the old headline and stares hard at the photo of the bent and heavily damaged automobile laying inverted in the middle of the highway.

The back of the store, which is some type of art gallery where all the framed pictures are images and sketches from comic books, is started towards by Elijah. The longest time passes while Elijah stands staring, and then he walks closer to them. When Elijah speaks, a whispery quality is carried by his voice. He nods while Elijah looks shaken, and David is gazed at by Elijah, who then points at the framed comic sketches. His head is shaken by David, who smiles out of frustration. Elijah watches David walk towards the front door, and Joseph is seen through the window taking David's hand as they cross the street. Out the window, Elijah gazes in a bit of a daze. In bed, David sits up staring at a torn section of newspaper in his hands, while Joseph is asleep horizontally with his legs over David's legs. David slides out from under his son's legs; Joseph stirs but doesn't wake up. The darkness of the corner of the room is moved to by David, and a closet door is opened; a naked hanging bulb is turned on as a chain is yanked by David. The narrow closet is stepped inside by David, and the door is closed slightly by him so the light from the bulb doesn't fall on Joseph. Just enough room is allowed for standing and looking around as the top shelf is stretched and felt on by David. Down comes his hand with something wrapped in a t-shirt, which is unwrapped by him to reveal a handgun. A beat is stared at before it is wrapped back up by him and replaced on the highest shelf. Stretching even more, farther back is reached by him, and a folder jammed with clippings is pulled down. The folder is opened by him to reveal a young David in a football uniform holding his helmet in the air victoriously. Through the top clippings, all images and stories of David and football are flipped by David, then the pile is turned over by him to the last clipping. Over three times, this piece of paper is folded, unlike the others; a newspaper headline is shown. The new headline is put next to the old one by David, and like a set, they look, even the font is similar. The old headline is stared at by David, and the photo of the bent and heavily damaged car laying upside down in the middle of the highway is stared hard at by him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The other is half human, half animal. Elijah glances at the businessman beside him, then back at the sketch. The businessman rubs his face, gazing at the sketch. Elijah moves to the back of the store, an art gallery with framed comic book images and sketches. He jams his walking stick into the thick carpet, stops, and returns to the businessman, shaking his head. Elijah's eyes pierce the shaken man as he points at the sketch. Facing the customers for the first time, Elijah sees David Dunne with Joseph. Elijah stares for a long time, then approaches them. When he speaks, his voice is whispery. David nods while Elijah looks shaken, then points at the comic sketches. David shakes his head, smiling in frustration. Elijah watches David head to the front door, seeing Joseph take David's hand as they cross the street. Elijah gazes out the window, dazed. David sits in bed, staring at a torn newspaper section, while Joseph sleeps with his legs over David's. David slides out, Joseph stirs but doesn't wake. David moves to a dark corner, opens a closet, and turns on a naked bulb by yanking a chain. He steps inside, closes the door slightly, and stretches to feel the top shelf. He retrieves something wrapped in a t-shirt, revealing a handgun, stares at it, then wraps it back up and replaces it. Stretching further, he pulls down a folder filled with clippings. Inside is a young David in a football uniform, holding his helmet victoriously. David flips through clippings of himself and football, then turns to the last one, a newspaper headline. He places the new headline next to the old one; they look like a set, even the font is similar. David stares at the old headline and the photo of a damaged car upside down on the highway.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: One is half human, half animal. Elijah glances at the businessman beside him, then at the sketch. The businessman rubs his face, gazing at it. Elijah moves to the back of the store, an art gallery with framed comic book images. He jams his walking stick into the thick carpet, stops, and returns to the businessman, shaking his head. Elijah's eyes pierce the shaken man as he points at the sketch. Facing the customers, Elijah sees David Dunne with Joseph. Elijah stares, then approaches them. Speaking in a whispery voice, Elijah looks shaken. David nods, frustrated, and Elijah watches him walk to the door. Through the window, Elijah sees Joseph take David's hand as they cross the street, gazing in a daze. David sits in bed, staring at a torn newspaper, while Joseph sleeps with his legs over David's. David slides out, moves to a dark corner, opens a closet, and turns on a bulb. Inside, he finds a handgun wrapped in a t-shirt, stares at it, then replaces it. He retrieves a folder of clippings, revealing a young David in a football uniform. David flips through clippings of his football days, then examines a folded newspaper headline. He places it next to an old one, noting their similarity. David stares at the old headline and the photo of a damaged car upside down on the highway.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The other figure in the scene is a curious blend, being half human and half animal. Elijah, with a thoughtful expression, glances over at the businessman who is standing right next to him, and then shifts his gaze back to the intriguing sketch. The businessman, appearing somewhat perplexed, rubs his face thoughtfully and continues to gaze at the sketch with a furrowed brow. Elijah then makes his way towards the back of the store, which is actually a kind of art gallery. This gallery is unique in that all the framed pictures adorning the walls are images and sketches derived from comic books. As Elijah moves, he firmly jams his walking stick into the extra thick carpet, coming to a halt. He turns around and begins to make his way back to the businessman, shaking his head with a strong, decisive motion. Elijah's eyes, sharp and penetrating, seem to pierce through the visibly shaken man as he points emphatically at the sketch. Turning once more, Elijah faces the customers for the very first time; among them, David Dunne stands alongside Joseph. Elijah remains standing there, staring intently for what feels like the longest time, before he finally walks closer to them. When Elijah finally speaks, his voice carries a whispery, almost ethereal quality. David nods in response, while Elijah, appearing somewhat shaken, gazes intently at David, then gestures towards the framed comic sketches. David, in turn, shakes his head and offers a smile that seems tinged with frustration. Elijah watches as David makes his way towards the front door, and through the window, he observes Joseph taking David's hand as they cross the street together. Elijah continues to gaze out the window, appearing somewhat dazed and lost in thought. Meanwhile, David sits up in bed, his eyes fixed on a torn section of newspaper that he holds in his hands, while Joseph sleeps soundly, sprawled horizontally with his legs draped over David's. Carefully, David slides out from under his son's legs; Joseph stirs slightly but does not wake up. David then moves quietly to the darkened corner of the room, opens a closet door, and as he pulls a chain, a naked hanging bulb flickers on. David steps into the narrow confines of the closet and closes the door slightly so that the light from the bulb doesn't disturb Joseph. There is just enough room for him to stand and look around as he stretches and feels along the top shelf. His hand comes down with an object wrapped in a t-shirt, which he carefully unwraps to reveal a handgun. He stares at it for a moment, lost in thought, before wrapping it back up and placing it back on the highest shelf. Stretching even more, he reaches farther back and pulls down a folder that is jammed with clippings. Opening the folder, he reveals a photograph of a young David in a football uniform, proudly holding his helmet aloft in a victorious pose. David flips through the top clippings, which are all images and stories of his past achievements in football, then turns the pile over to the very last clipping. This particular piece of paper is folded over three times, unlike the others; it is a newspaper headline. David places the new headline next to the old one, and they appear to be a matching set, even the font is strikingly similar. David stares intently at the old headline, his gaze lingering on the photo of the bent and heavily damaged car lying upside down in the middle of the highway.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The other prominent figure present in the scene is an intriguing and curious amalgamation, being part human and part animal in appearance. Elijah, wearing a deeply contemplative expression, shifts his gaze toward the businessman who is positioned immediately next to him. After a brief moment, Elijah redirects his attentive eyes back to the captivating sketch that has captured his interest. The businessman, who appears to be somewhat bewildered by what he sees, thoughtfully rubs his face and continues to stare at the sketch with a distinctly furrowed brow, suggesting deep contemplation. Elijah, after a moment, begins to make his way towards the back interior of the store, which is in fact a kind of art gallery. This gallery is remarkable and unique for its collection; all the framed pictures adorning the walls are images and sketches that have been derived from various comic books. As Elijah moves diligently through the room, he firmly jams his walking stick into the exceptionally thick carpet, eventually coming to a deliberate halt. He then turns around and starts to make his way back towards the businessman, shaking his head with a strong and decisive motion. Elijah’s eyes, which are sharp and penetrating, seem as if they pierce through the visibly unsettled man as he pointedly gestures at the sketch. Turning once again, Elijah faces the collection of customers for the very first time; among them stand David Dunne and his companion Joseph. Elijah remains in his place, staring intently for what feels like an interminable length of time, before he finally decides to walk closer to them. When Elijah eventually speaks, his voice carries a whispery and almost ethereal quality, as though it comes from another world. David responds with a nod, while Elijah, visibly somewhat shaken, continues to gaze intently at David, then makes a distinct gesture towards the framed comic sketches on the wall. David, in response, shakes his head and offers a smile that seems laced with a hint of frustration. Elijah watches as David makes his way toward the front door, and through the window, he observes Joseph taking David’s hand as they cross the street together. Elijah continues to gaze out the window, appearing somewhat dazed, as if lost in thought. Meanwhile, on the other side of this scene, David sits up in bed, his eyes fixed intently on a torn section of newspaper that he holds in his hand. Next to him, Joseph sleeps soundly, sprawled horizontally across the bed, with his legs comfortably draped over David’s. Carefully and quietly, David slides out from under his son’s legs; Joseph stirs slightly but remains asleep, undisturbed. David then moves with measured silence to the darkened corner of the room, where he opens a closet door and pulls a chain, causing a naked hanging bulb to flicker on. David steps into the narrow confines of the closet space and closes the door slightly so that the light from the bulb doesn’t disturb Joseph’s sleep. There is just enough room for him to stand and look around as he stretches his arms and feels along the top shelf. His hand comes down with an object wrapped in a t-shirt, which he carefully unwraps to reveal a handgun. He stares at it for a moment, seemingly lost in thought, before he wraps it back up and places it on the highest shelf. Stretching even further, he reaches back and pulls down a folder that is crammed full of clippings. Opening the folder, he reveals a photograph of a young David, dressed in a football uniform, proudly holding his helmet aloft in a victorious pose. David flips through the top clippings, which are all images and stories depicting his past achievements in football, before he turns the pile over to the very last clipping. This particular piece of paper is folded over three times, unlike the others; it reveals a newspaper headline. David places the new headline beside the old one, and they appear to be a matching set, with even the font being strikingly similar. David stares intently at the old headline, his gaze lingering on the photo of the bent and heavily damaged car lying upside down in the middle of the highway.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The other figure in the scene is a being that is half human and half animal. Elijah, standing nearby, shifts his gaze from the business man beside him to the sketch in front of them. The business man, feeling the weight of the moment, rubs his face with his hand and directs his attention to the sketch as well. Elijah, deciding to move, begins to make his way towards the back of the store, which is designed as an art gallery showcasing framed pictures that are images and sketches derived from comic books. As he progresses, Elijah forcefully plants his walking stick into the thick carpet, coming to a halt. He then pivots on his spot and makes his way back towards the businessman, shaking his head with a strong, decisive motion. Elijah's eyes, intense and penetrating, lock onto the visibly unsettled man as he gestures emphatically at the sketch. Turning away, Elijah faces the other customers in the store for the first time, noticing David Dunne standing there with Joseph. Elijah remains still, staring intently for what feels like an extended period before he finally approaches them. When Elijah finally speaks, his voice carries a whispery, almost ethereal quality. David acknowledges Elijah's words with a nod, while Elijah, appearing somewhat shaken, continues to gaze at David before directing his attention to the framed comic sketches. In response, David shakes his head, a smile of frustration playing on his lips. Elijah watches as David makes his way towards the front door, and through the window, he observes Joseph taking David's hand as they cross the street together. Elijah remains at the window, his expression slightly dazed as he watches them leave. Later, David is seen sitting up in bed, his eyes fixed on a torn section of newspaper he holds in his hands, while Joseph lies asleep beside him, his legs draped over David's. Carefully, David slides out from under Joseph's legs, causing Joseph to stir slightly but not wake. David then moves quietly to the darkened corner of the room, where he opens a closet door, pulling a chain to illuminate the space with the light of a naked bulb. Stepping into the narrow confines of the closet, David partially closes the door to prevent the light from disturbing Joseph. In the limited space, he stretches his arm upwards, feeling along the top shelf until his hand comes down with an object wrapped in a t-shirt. Unwrapping it, he reveals a handgun, which he stares at for a moment before wrapping it back up and returning it to the highest shelf. Reaching even further back, he retrieves a folder stuffed with clippings. Opening the folder, he finds a photograph of a younger version of himself in a football uniform, triumphantly holding his helmet aloft. David flips through the top clippings, all of which depict images and stories of his football days, before turning to the last clipping in the pile. This particular piece of paper is folded over three times, unlike the others, and features a newspaper headline. Placing the new headline next to the old one, he notices how they resemble a set, even down to the similar font. David's gaze lingers on the old headline, his eyes focusing intently on the accompanying photo of a severely damaged car lying upside down in the middle of the highway.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Elijah, observing a half-human, half-animal sketch, glances at a businessman beside him, who also examines the artwork. Elijah moves to the back of the art gallery, which features comic book images and sketches, and then returns to the businessman, shaking his head emphatically. He points at the sketch, his eyes piercing the businessman, before turning to face the customers, including David Dunne and his son Joseph. After a long stare, Elijah approaches them and speaks in a whispery tone. David nods, appearing frustrated, as Elijah points to the comic sketches. Elijah watches David and Joseph leave the gallery, observing them through the window as they cross the street hand in hand.

Later, David sits in bed, examining a torn newspaper section while Joseph sleeps with his legs draped over David's. Carefully, David slides out from under Joseph's legs and moves to a dark corner of the room. He opens a closet, illuminating it with a naked bulb, and steps inside, closing the door slightly to keep the light from waking Joseph. In the cramped space, David retrieves a handgun wrapped in a t-shirt from the top shelf, stares at it briefly, then wraps it back up and replaces it. Stretching further, he pulls down a folder filled with clippings, revealing images and stories of his past football achievements. He flips through them to a folded newspaper headline, placing it next to another similar headline. David intensely examines the old headline and the photo of a damaged car overturned on the highway.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The other is half human, half animal, reminiscent of mythological creatures like the Egyptian god Anubis, who is often depicted as part human, part jackal. Elijah glances at the businessman standing next to him and then back to the sketch that suggests a story of transformation. The businessman, likely a regular at the gallery known for his keen interest in unique art pieces, rubs his face and gazes at the sketch. Elijah starts to the back of the store, which is some type of art gallery famous for its avant-garde and pop culture-themed exhibits, where all the framed pictures are images and sketches from comic books known for their vibrant storytelling. Elijah jams his walking stick into the extra thick carpet that muffles footsteps, enhancing the gallery's atmosphere of quiet contemplation, and stops. He turns and starts back to the businessman, shaking his head strongly as if to refute an unspoken claim. Elijah's eyes pierce through the shaken man as he points at the sketch, highlighting its significance. Elijah turns and faces the customers for the first time; David Dunne, a man of mysterious resilience, stands with his son Joseph. Elijah just stands staring for the longest time, as if measuring their reactions, and then walks closer to them. When Elijah speaks, his voice has a whispery quality to it, like rustling leaves. David nods while Elijah looks shaken, and Elijah gazes at David, then points at the framed comic sketches, which seem to hold answers to unasked questions. David shakes his head and smiles out of frustration, a common reaction to unsolved puzzles. Elijah watches David walk towards the front door, and through the window, he sees Joseph take David's hand as they cross the street, embodying a touching father-son bond. Elijah gazes out the window in a bit of a daze, as if lost in thought. David sits up in bed staring at a torn section of newspaper in his hands, while Joseph is asleep horizontally with his legs over David's legs, a testament to their close relationship. David slides out from under his son's legs; Joseph stirs but doesn't wake up, a picture of youthful innocence. David moves to the darkness of the corner of the room, opens a closet door, and a naked hanging bulb goes on as David yanks a chain, casting a harsh light on the secrets within. David steps inside the narrow closet and closes the door slightly so the light from the bulb doesn't fall on Joseph, preserving his son's sleep. There's just enough room to stand and look around as David stretches and feels on the top shelf, an action that speaks of routine familiarity. His hand comes down with something wrapped in a t-shirt, which he unwraps to reveal a handgun, an object filled with ominous potential. He stares at it for a beat before wrapping it back up and replacing it to the highest shelf, as if hiding away part of his past. He stretches even more, reaches farther back, and pulls down a folder jammed with clippings, the kind collected over a lifetime. He opens the folder to reveal a young David in football uniform holding his helmet in the air victoriously, a moment captured in glory. David flips through the top clippings, which are all images and stories of David and football, then turns the pile over to the last clipping, seeking answers in history. This piece of paper is folded over three times, unlike the others; it's a newspaper headline marking a significant event. David puts the new headline next to the old one, and they look like a set, even the font is similar, as if history repeats itself. David stares at the old headline and stares hard at the photo of the bent and heavily damaged car laying upside down in the middle of the highway, a haunting reminder of a life-altering moment.

High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. while Joseph is asleep horizontally with his legs over David's legs. David slides out from under his son's legs. Joseph stirs but does not wake up. David moves to the darkness of the corner of the room. opens a closet door and a naked hanging bulb goes on as David yanks a chain. David steps inside the narrow closet and closes the door slightly so the light from the bulb does not fall on Joseph. There is just enough room to stand and look around as David stretches and feels on the top shelf. His hand comes down with something wrapped in a tshirt which he unwraps to reveal a handgun. He stares at it for a beat before wrapping it back up and replacing it to the highest shelf. He stretches even more reaches farther back and pulls down a folder jammed with clippings. He opens the folder to reveal a young David in football uniform holding his helmet in the air victoriously. David flips through the top clippings which are all images and stories of David and football. then turns the pile over to the last clipping. This piece of paper is folded over three times. unlike the others it is a newspaper headline. David puts the new headline next to the old one and they look like a set. even the font is similar. David stares at the old headline and stares hard at the photo of the bent and heavily damaged car laying upside down in the middle of the highway.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: The other is half human half animal. Elijah glances at the business man standing next to him and then back to the sketch. The business man rubs his face and gazes at the sketch. Elijah starts to the back of the store which is some type of art gallery where all the framed pictures are images and sketches from comic books. Elijah jams his walking stick into the extra thick carpet and stops. He turns and starts back to the businessman shaking his head strongly. Elijah's eyes pierce through the shaken man as he points at the sketch. Elijah turns and faces the customers for the first time. David Dunne stands with Joseph. He stretches even more reaches farther back and pulls down a folder jammed with clippings. He opens the folder to reveal a young David in football uniform holding his helmet in the air victoriously. David flips through the top clippings which are all images and stories of David and football. then turns the pile over to the last clipping. This piece of paper is folded over three times. unlike the others it is a newspaper headline. David puts the new headline next to the old one and they look like a set. even the font is similar. David stares at the old headline and stares hard at the photo of the bent and heavily damaged car laying upside down in the middle of the highway.

The business man rubs his face and gazes at the sketch. unlike the others it is a newspaper headline. David puts the new headline next to the old one and they look like a set. even the font is similar. David stares at the old headline and stares hard at the photo of the bent and heavily damaged car laying upside down in the middle of the highway.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The creature is half robot, half bird. Samantha peeks at the chef lounging beside her and then back to the painting. The chef pats his nose and squints at the painting. Samantha ambles to the front of the museum, which is some type of dance studio where all the ornate sculptures are models and paintings from fairy tales. Samantha hurls her umbrella into the dense foam pillow and halts. She pivots and saunters back to the chef, nodding her head weakly. Samantha's eyes slice through the confused baker as she gestures at the painting. Samantha pivots and faces the performers for the first time; Robert Reed stands with Alice. Samantha just stands blinking for the longest time and then waltzes closer to them. When Samantha whispers, her tone has a playful quality to it. Robert shrugs while Samantha appears startled, and Samantha squints at Robert, then gestures at the ornate fairy tale paintings. Robert shakes his head and grins out of annoyance. Samantha observes Robert stroll towards the rear window, and through the glass, she notices Alice grab Robert's wrist as they skip down the alley. Samantha stares through the mirror in a bit of a haze. Robert lies down in the hammock scanning a torn section of magazine in his grasp, while Alice dozes vertically with her arms over Robert's arms. Robert wiggles out from under his daughter's arms; Alice twitches but remains asleep. Robert shifts to the brightness of the center of the attic, unlocks a drawer handle, and a vibrant hanging light turns on as Robert tugs a lever. Robert enters the shallow drawer and latches the handle slightly so the glow from the light doesn't spill onto Alice. There's just enough space to crouch and glance around as Robert bends and fumbles on the bottom panel. His fingers descend with something enclosed in a scarf, which he unwraps to expose a flashlight. He gawks at it for a moment before bundling it back up and placing it on the lowest panel. He bends even further, extends further down, and retrieves a notebook stuffed with comics. He flips the notebook to display a young Robert in a basketball jersey hoisting his sneakers in the air triumphantly. Robert rifles through the top comics, which are all depictions and stories of Robert and basketball, then turns the bundle over to the final comic. This image is folded over four times, unlike the others; it's a brochure headline. Robert places the new caption beside the old one, and they appear like a pair, even the typeface is alike. Robert gawks at the aged caption and gazes intently at the image of the twisted and badly crushed bicycle resting sideways in the center of the plaza.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Elijah, half human, half animal, examines a sketch in an art gallery filled with comic book images. He interacts with a businessman, expressing disapproval before noticing David Dunne and his son Joseph among the customers. Elijah's whispery voice leaves David visibly frustrated, and Elijah watches them leave, lost in thought. Later, David, in bed with Joseph, who is asleep, quietly moves to a closet. He cautiously retrieves a handgun wrapped in a t-shirt, stares at it momentarily, then places it back on the shelf. Stretching further, David retrieves a folder of clippings depicting his past as a triumphant football player. He compares an old newspaper headline featuring a mangled car to a new one, noticing their similarity, and stares intensely at the image of the wreck.
